oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Burn 1918 campaign poster
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Campaign poster for Harry T. Burn, 1918. 8.5 x 11", framed (some insect damage). "Your Vote and Influence Solicited HARRY T. BURN, Niota, Tennessee. Republican Nominee for Representative. Election Tuesday, November 5th, 1918." Includes picture of Harry T. Burn. This was the election that first placed him in the Tennessee House of Representatives, where in 1920 he cast the deciding vote to support female suffrage. His vote broke the tie in the Tennessee legislature, causing Tennessee to pass the amendment. Tennessee was the 36th state to ratify the Nineteenth Amendment, making it the law of the land.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Portraits; Politicians; Political campaigns; Ephemera;
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: unknown
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Harry T. Burn Papers - 1918 campaign poster, framed
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: C.M. McClung Historical Collection, Knox County Public Library
